title: Russian elite brace for sweeping Kremlin investigation into Wagner rebellion
description: Moscow steels for a sweeping investigation into last weekend’s mercenary rebellion with officials likely to be interrogated on their links to Wagner paramilitary boss Yevgeniy Prigozhin.

title: How countries around the world handle affirmative action in admissions
description: The Supreme Court’s decision to restrict racial considerations in affirmative action for university admissions could set the United States on a different path from some other countries that practice their own versions of affirmative action.

title: Woman loses leg after moving walkway accident at Bangkok airport
description: She had part of her left leg amputated after her foot was stuck in a moving walkway.

title: Shootout near U.S. Consulate in Saudi Arabia leaves guard, gunman dead
description: The gunman opened fire outside the consulate in Jiddah, in western Saudi Arabia, forcing it to lock down. The assailant's identity and motive are unknown.

title: A building boom fueled by corruption is changing the face of Baghdad
description: It is a lucrative time for Iraqi developers, hailed by politicians as a sign of Baghdad’s revival. But the real estate market is also a magnet for dirty money.

title: Australia offers MDMA drug therapy for PTSD, a world first
description: Australia is allowing legal access to MDMA-assisted therapy, unexpectedly turning itself into a guinea pig ahead of potential FDA approval in the United States.

title: Uruguay can’t figure out what do with its Nazi eagle
description: Treasure hunters recovered the more than six-foot-tall, 770-pound, swastika-bearing bronze eagle from a German cruiser scuttled after the first naval battle of World War II.

title: A husband was committed to a psych ward. Then he committed his wife.
description: Reports of a husband and wife in China who were both involuntarily admitted to a psychiatric ward highlight problems with the treatment of mental illness.

title: France arrests 150 as violent protests spread over police killing of a teen
description: Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin said town halls, schools and police stations were attacked and burned during a night of "intolerable violence."

title: Ukraine live briefing: Putin rallies public support after mutiny; children among Kramatorsk dead
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin made a rare public appearance before a crowd, as Western leaders said the Wagner Group rebellion had weakened him.

title: A historic rise in global conflict deaths suggests a violent new era
description: More than 238,000 people died in global conflict last year, according to a new study, marking a 96 percent increase year over year.
